alert.note: Alert for Nicholas; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 9:59AM EST until February 06 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River at Blue Licks Spring affecting Robertson and Nicholas Counties. .The river has remained somewhat steady the last couple of hours. It is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River at Blue Licks Spring. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Cropland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 25.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Saturday was 27.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 14.8 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.3 feet on 06/18/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued as the forecast gets update.
